# Layoffs are piling up, heightening worker anxiety. Here are some of the biggest recent job cuts

## Here are a few companies that have announced some of the largest job cuts recently.

#### By Wyatte Grantham-philips \| The Associated Press •Published January 31, 2026•Updated on January 31, 2026 at 6:56 am

BOOKMARKER

NBCUniversal, Inc.

Losing your job can be a very stressful experience, but there are ways to make it a little easier for you and your family. From filing for unemployment to choosing health insurance, here’s what you need to know if you’ve been laid off.

As layoffs pile up, workers are feeling increasingly anxious about the job market.

In the U.S., [economists have said](https://www.nbcconnecticut.com/tag/economy/) that businesses are largely at [a “no-hire, no fire” standstill](https://www.nbcconnecticut.com/news/business/money-report/its-a-low-firing-low-hiring-job-market-economist-says-heres-how-to-land-a-new-gig-anyway/), leading many to limit new work, if not pause openings entirely amid economic uncertainty. Hiring has stagnated overall — with the country adding a meager 50,000 jobs last month, down from a revised figure of 56,000 in November.
